channel.title: Interview Preparation on Mianshi Handbook
channel.description: Recent content in Interview Preparation on Mianshi Handbook

item.title: What do you know about Our Business?
item.description: Gordon Foundation is a charitable organization. Gordon Foundation initiated DataStream program. The goal is to share the data. In order to do that, data must be standardized, verified, to comply with an observation-level data schema (standard) based on WQX standard (It was designed to enable multiple monitoring entities to share results in a common format). DataStream was first piloted in the Mackenzie Basin with the support and collaboration of the Government of the Northwest Territories.

item.title: Are You Interested in Travelling
item.description: Does travel bother you? not at all. I like driving and staying in hotel. In fact, I could concentrate on doing things at hotel than at home. How much travel did you have to do in your previous role? And what type of distance were you traveling?

item.title: Strength and Weakness
item.description: Strength: technical savvy. Weakness: there are still lots to learn. Learn programming codes on the job. had few presentation opportunities at work, but practiced the skillset at Toastmasters. syllable missing. I have done a self-assessment for data scientists and data analysts. Strength: I am a good listener. I am focused on getting tangible business results with data. no problem of talking in front of a group.

item.title: Tell Me About Yourself
item.description: My field of study in university is Chemistry, in graduate school my study is polymer chemistry. I used gel permeation chromatography (GPC), Differential Scanning Calorimetry (DSC) and Thermal Gravimetric Analysis (TGA) to study characterization of polymer materials. After graduation, I developed skills and experience in chemical analysis and lab accreditation in Total and SGS in China since year 2000. We immigrated to Canada in 2004. I worked at Testmark environmental labs to provide accredited analysis for environmental monitoring and drinking water quality.

item.title: What Did You Do at
item.description: What did you do at LifeLabs? I was hired at LifeLabs as a lab scientist. I was in responsible for steroid profiling in urine, which included quality control, troubleshooting on analysis and instruments, and method development. I developed two applications to monitor the instrument (GC-MS/MS detector, and lab test data, such as sample data, and QC data).

item.title: What do you know about Our Business?
item.description: Knowledge about Sysmex products # Hematology analyzer for large and small labs. blood coagulation analyzer - Hemostasis. Urinalysis analyzer Flow cytometry Informatics solutions

item.title: Why Us?
item.description: ) Career perspective: It is an opportunity of career advancement. There are many data. development. in line with my experience. I love to organize data. )

item.title: Work With Clients
item.description: How would you work with the client? Two aspects: people interaction and technical aspects. Listen client’s complain Easy the emotion Commitment Identify the problem

item.title: Interview Prep

item.description: First Interview # Interview Questions Prepared # Tell me about yourself My field of study in university is Chemistry, in graduate school my study is polymer chemistry. I used gel permeation chromatography (GPC), Differential Scanning Calorimetry (DSC) and Thermalgravimetric Analysis (TGA) to study characterization of polymer materials. After graduation, I developed skills and experience in chemical analysis and lab accreditation in Total and SGS in China since year 2000.
